body_html:
Hello!
I modified the nodes because I had a bug when they weren't switch and I found on stackoverflow that the way of overcoming that bug is to just switch them individually.

Anyway the big picture:

I have various trained models in checkpoints that I then export into a pb/variables file which needs to then be converted into a frozen graph for me to then use a graph optimizer. So far I had been working with frozen graphs online and didn't expect this process of freezing a model from checkpoints to be this complicated.

I checked the tags of my pb files with that comment and I have one with serve and the other with train tags. I put them through the code above with only the last layer name and managed to make visualizable graph through tensorboard that I can't load using the second part of the code. At this point I am pretty sure that when I am exporting the graph to a saved pb or when I am freezing it there is an issue creating the input layer such that i can load it an then do inference with it.

Thank you!
Nyla

body:
Hello!
I modified the nodes because I had a bug when they weren't switch and I found on stackoverflow that the way of overcoming that bug is to just switch them individually. 

Anyway the big picture:

I have various trained models in checkpoints that I then export into a pb/variables file which needs to then be converted into a frozen graph for me to then use a graph optimizer. So far I had been working with frozen graphs online and didn't expect this process of freezing a model from checkpoints to be this complicated. 

I checked the tags of my pb files with that comment and I have one with serve and the other with train tags. I put them through the code above with only the last layer name and managed to make visualizable graph through tensorboard that I can't load using the second part of the code. At this point I am pretty sure that when I am exporting the graph to a saved pb or when I am freezing it there is an issue creating the input layer such that i can load it an then do inference with it. 

Thank you!
Nyla
